Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP034
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP034.model

Interface IRules

All Known Implementing Classes:
Apollo, Artemis, Athena, Atlas, DefaultRules, Demeter, GodsRules, Hephaestus, Hera, Hestia, Limus, Minotaur, Pan, Prometheus, Triton, Zeus
public interface IRules
Interface containing the methods that form the proper game rules.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean anyValidBuild​(Worker worker)
    Checks if a given worker has any valid build available.
    boolean anyValidMove​(Worker worker)
    Checks if a given worker has any valid move available.
    void build​(Tile buildTile)
    Builds a new level (or dome, following Default construction rules) on the given tile.
    boolean checkBuildLost​(Player player)
    Method checks if there are any possible build actions for a given player, checking both workers.
    boolean checkMoveLost​(Player player)
    Method checks if there are any possible moves for a given player, checking both workers.
    boolean checkWin​(Worker worker)
    Method applies winning condition rules.
    Sex getChosenSex()
    Returns the last saved worker's sex.
    DefaultRules getDefaultRules()  
    Tile getPreviousTile()
    Returns the last tile saved while performing an action.
    void move​(Worker worker, Tile destinationTile)
    Moves a given worker to the given tile
    void setChosenSex​(Worker chosenWorker)
    Saves a worker's sex.
    void setPreviousTile​(Tile tile)
    Saves a tile.
    boolean validBuild​(Worker worker, Tile buildingTile)
    Method checks if a given build is valid.
    boolean validMove​(Worker worker, Tile destinationTile)
    Method checks if a given move is valid.

  • Method Details

    • getPreviousTile

      Tile getPreviousTile()
      Returns the last tile saved while performing an action.
      Returns:
      Reference to previous tile.

    • getChosenSex

      Sex getChosenSex()
      Returns the last saved worker's sex. Used to keep track of worker used throughout a player's turn.
      Returns:
      Saved sex.

    • getDefaultRules

      DefaultRules getDefaultRules()

    • move

      void move​(Worker worker, Tile destinationTile)
      Moves a given worker to the given tile
      Parameters:
      worker - Reference to the worker to be moved.
      destinationTile - Reference to the destination of the action.

    • build

      void build​(Tile buildTile)
      Builds a new level (or dome, following Default construction rules) on the given tile.
      Parameters:
      buildTile - Reference to the tile to be modified.

    • validMove

      boolean validMove​(Worker worker, Tile destinationTile)
      Method checks if a given move is valid.
      Parameters:
      worker - Reference to the worker to be moved.
      destinationTile - Reference to the destination tile.
      Returns:
      true if move is valid, false otherwise.

    • validBuild

      boolean validBuild​(Worker worker, Tile buildingTile)
      Method checks if a given build is valid.
      Parameters:
      worker - Reference to the worker who is building.
      buildingTile - Reference to the building tile.
      Returns:
      true if build is valid, false otherwise.

    • checkWin

      boolean checkWin​(Worker worker)
      Method applies winning condition rules.
      Parameters:
      worker - Reference to the Worker that was moved.
      Returns:
      true if a Worker actively moved from level TWO to level THREE.

    • setChosenSex

      void setChosenSex​(Worker chosenWorker)
      Saves a worker's sex. Used to keep track of worker used throughout a player's turn.
      Parameters:
      chosenWorker - Worker used.

    • setPreviousTile

      void setPreviousTile​(Tile tile)
      Saves a tile. Used to keep track of tile used throughout a player's turn.
      Parameters:
      tile - Previous tile.

    • anyValidMove

      boolean anyValidMove​(Worker worker)
      Checks if a given worker has any valid move available.
      Parameters:
      worker - Reference to the worker to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if the given worker has at least one available possible move.

    • checkMoveLost

      boolean checkMoveLost​(Player player)
      Method checks if there are any possible moves for a given player, checking both workers.
      Parameters:
      player - Reference to the player checked.
      Returns:
      true if there are no moves left so that the player lost, false if the player can keep playing, as at least there is one possible move left.

    • anyValidBuild

      boolean anyValidBuild​(Worker worker)
      Checks if a given worker has any valid build available.
      Parameters:
      worker - Reference to the worker to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if the given worker has at least one available possible build.

    • checkBuildLost

      boolean checkBuildLost​(Player player)
      Method checks if there are any possible build actions for a given player, checking both workers.
      Parameters:
      player - Reference to the player checked.
      Returns:
      true if there are no build actions left so that the player lost, false if the player can keep playing, as at least there is one possible build actions left.
